intro: Cienfuegosia rosei, commonly known as the roseleaf cienfuegosia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-like pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and prefers partial shade. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant in gardens and conservation areas.
